blockchain.definition: An immutable, decentralized database. Like a ledger that everyone can read but no one can change.
blockchain.example: Bitcoin is the most famous blockchain. Every transaction is stored there forever.

address.definition: Like an IBAN, but for cryptocurrencies. A unique ID for receiving money.

transaction.definition: A transfer from address A to address B. All transactions are publicly visible.
transaction.example: Alice sends 0.5 BTC to Bob - everyone can see this transaction on the blockchain
